conclusion: Analyze the image to understand the flow path of the liquid.
Identify the containers and baffles, trace the possible paths, and determine which container the liquid will flow into.
The image shows a setup with three containers labeled A, B, and C, each with a liquid flow path.
Below these containers, there are three containers labeled D, E, and F.
The liquid flows through baffles, indicated by arrows, to reach the containers below.
The liquid flows out from containers A, B, and C.
The liquid from A flows through a baffle and into a container labeled D.
The liquid from B flows through a baffle and into a container labeled E.
The liquid from C flows through a baffle and into a container labeled F.
Based on the flow paths and baffles, the liquid from A goes to D, from B to E, and from C to F.
Therefore, the liquid will flow into containers D, E, and F, respectively, after passing through the baffles.
